utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here’s what I wonder about zombies. What happens if they can’t get any human flesh to eat? They can’t starve to death, they’re already dead.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You take this one. I spent an hour last night on how do vampires shave when they can’t see themselves in the mirror?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well-groomed vampires meet in pairs and shave each other. Case closed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, so, zombies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I guess it depends on the zombies, Raj. Are we talking slow zombies, fast zombies? Like, in 28 Days, if those zombies didn’t eat, they starved.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re thinking of 28 Days Later. 28 Days is where Sandra Bullock goes to rehab and puts the audience into an undead state

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, don’t bag on Sandra Bullock! You think it makes you look cultured, but you just come off as bitter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Siebert, twelve o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why’s the president of the university slumming in the cafeteria?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps he’s emulating Shakespeare’s Henry V, who dressed as a commoner and mingled among them, to find out how he was being perceived by his subjects. Course, if he’d have read any of the thirteen hundred e-mails I’ve sent him on the subject of his administration, he could have saved himself the trouble.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Or maybe he heard it’s Tator Tot Tuesday. That’s why I’m here.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Seibert
utterance.content: Hey, there’s my favorite geniuses! How are we doing today?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That depends, how much longer do you plan on fondling my shoulder?

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Sorry, Dr. Cooper, I forgot you have a touch phobia.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not a touch phobia, it’s a germ phobia. If you’d like to go put on a pair of latex gloves,

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Yeah. So, listen, fellas, who’s up for a little party this Saturday night? Open bar, good eats, might even be a few pretty girls.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sounds great!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m in!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on. Just because the nice man is offering you candy, doesn’t mean you should jump into his windowless van. What’s the occasion?

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Just a little fund-raiser for the university.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aha! The tear-stained air mattress in the back of the van.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: I understand your reticence, Dr. Cooper, and I sympathize, but the hard facts are, occasionally, we have to shake a few hands and kiss a few butts to raise money for our research.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care, it’s demeaning. And I refuse to be trotted out and shown off like a prize hog at the Texas State Fair. Which, by the way, is something you don’t want to attend wearing a Star Trek ensign’s uniform.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: All right, let me put it this way. You’re gonna put on a suit, you’re gonna come to this party, and you’re gonna explain your research to a bunch of old people, or I swear to God, I’ll blind you with a hot spoon, like they did to that little boy in Slumdog Millionaire.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, you don’t want that.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: So, Saturday night! It’s gonna be off the hook.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Get over it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, boy! Tator tots and a party invitation? What a great day!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure this is right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, just tuck that part in your pants; you’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, let’s go smooch some rich, wrinkled tuckus.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Howard, I can’t believe Bernadette let you go to a fancy party wearing a dickey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Excuse me, my girlfriend doesn’t pick out my clothes. My mother does.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. We should get going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What about Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sheldon is not going.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? What do we tell Siebert?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tell him Dr. Cooper feels that the best use of his time is to employ his rare and precious mental faculties to tear the mask off nature and stare at the face of God.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s Saturday night, you’ll be doing laundry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t tell him that, tell him the mask thing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, put your tie back in your pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nice place. Reminds me of my parents’ house back in New Delhi.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. We are very wealthy. But the only difference is, we have more servants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: More than this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: More than we can use. You see, in India, we don’t make the mistake of letting our poor people have dreams.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Ah. There’s my band of brainiacs. Where’s Dr. Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s tearing the mask off nature to look at the face of God.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: The board of directors insists he has a beautiful mind. I think he’s just bananas. Come on, let me introduce you to one of the university’s leading donors.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think we were misled about the cute girls.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Mrs. Latham, I’d like you to meet three of our outstanding young researchers. This is Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali and Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, what happened to you, Wolowitz, couldn’t stick with it long enough to get your PhD?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m an engineer. Most engineers don’t bother with a PhD. But you may be interested to know I designed the zero-gravity waste-disposal system for NASA.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Got it, you’re a space plumber.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m gonna go hit the bar.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Tell me about these two.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do him first.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Dr. Hofstadter is representing our experimental physics program tonight. I think you’ll really enjoy hearing about his fascinating work.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Right. Fascinate me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh.. b.. d.. uh.. uh..

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: They’re cute when they’re about to wet themselves, aren’t they? I’ll make it easy for you. When you arrive at the lab in the morning, what sort of machine do you turn on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Coffee maker?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: All right, Dr. Kooth… uh, whatever it is, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s Koothrappali. I have to tinkle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And so, instead of bowing to pressure, and going to that pointless soiree, I stayed right here and did a load of whites.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on webcam)
utterance.content: Well, normally I respect your macho rebellious attitude toward The Man, but, in this case, I think you’ve made a foolish mistake.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Unlikely. But make your case. Keeping in mind that your critical attitude is ruining our Saturday night together, and I’m not above minimizing your window.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, like it or not, until you manage to upload your intelligence into a self-sustaining orbiting satellite, equipped with high-speed Internet and a cloaking device, you will be dependent on other members of the human race.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s it. Prepare to be minimized.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not finished. All scientists have to fund-raise, Sheldon. How do you think I paid for my lab?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your lab is funded by some Middle-Eastern dilettante?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Technically, Faisal is my fiance. But I do have a state-of-the-art two-photon microscope and a place to stay in Riyadh for the winter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that explains those puzzling camel race photos on your Facebook page.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And consider this, without you to make the case for the physics department, the task will fall to people like Leonard and Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you trying to scare me? ‘Cause you’re succeeding.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, then prepare to be terrified. If your friends are unconvincing, this year’s donations might go to, say, the geology department.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear,not, not the dirt people!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Or worse, it could go to the liberal arts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Millions of dollars being showered on poets, literary theorists and students of gender studies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, the humanities!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On the bright side, I don’t think President Siebert will be making us go to any more fund-raisers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was so much easier at my bar mitzvah. The old people just came up to you, pinched your cheek and handed you a savings bond.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, don’t be such gloomy Gusses. Look at the size of these shrimp! At what point do we start calling them lobsters?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Face it, Raj, we crashed and burned tonight.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Oh, you didn’t do that badly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mrs. Latham, the first machine I turn on in the morning is the helium-neon laser, ’cause it needs to warm up.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: I no longer care, dear. But don’t worry, I really enjoyed meeting you this evening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. That was good for you? ‘Cause I was sweating through my T-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Excellent! There’s nothing I like better than making smart people feel ill at ease.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know, it’s one of the fun things you get to do when you have lots of money. Watch. Hey! Who said you could eat that shrimp? See? Fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (behind them)
utterance.content: No, no, no, I’m just here for your money. I don’t want to shake anyone’s germy hands. Explain it to them, Siebert.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on phone)
utterance.content: I must confess I don’t understand you, President Siebert. First you say you want me to appear at your fund-raisers, but now you say you never want me to go anywhere near your fund-raisers. Forgive me, but that sounds like a mixed message. Here we go again. If there’s simply no talking to me, why did you call? I’m sorry, someone’s on the other line. Why don’t you see if you can organize your thoughts, and we’ll try again later. Cooper-Hofstadter residence. Go for Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hello, Mrs. Latham. Yes, I live with him. I don’t, I, I really don’t know why. Tonight? Sure, that’d be great. Okay, I’ll, I’ll see you then. Bye. She wants to have dinner and talk about my research.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: An entire dinner to talk about your research? Where you going, the drive-thru at Jack in the Box?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, wherever we’re going, she’s sending a car to pick me up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I see what’s happening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My stature intimidates her, so she’s using you to get to me. Crafty old gal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, but you are not the only distinguished scientist in this apartment. I’ve been published in peer-reviewed journals, I received a Dissertation of the Year award for experimental particle physics.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that can’t be it. And since you seem to have forgotten, the reason we live together is we’re best friends. And I got your back, Jack.

utterance.speaker: Secne
utterance.content: Mrs Latham’s car.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was a great meal.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: I’m glad you enjoyed it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The only time I eat this well is when my mom’s in town and she takes me out to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Is that so?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You kind of remind me of her. She enjoys making people uncomfortable, too.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, you remind me of a boy I dated in college.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No kidding.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Sweet boy. Very smart. If only he’d had money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, um, so, hey, speaking of money, how are you feeling about helping the physics department get a cryogenic centrifugal pump and molecular sieve?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, I must say, you make a very persuasive case for it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good, good.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: And I’m seriously considering taking it to the next level.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Terrific. Great. What level is that? Okay, now you don’t remind me of my mom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, so, eventually, zombies are going to attack the rehab facility where Sandra Bullock is?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, Sheldon. Keep watching.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, it’s a shame, all that work she’s doing to get sober, only to be torn apart and eaten alive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey. How was dinner?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Swell. I need a drink. Do we have any alcohol?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. But we have potatoes, I could make you vodka. It’ll take two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, Mrs. Latham said she was seriously considering donating money so we could get a cryogenic centrifugal pump.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, wow!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then she stuck her tongue down my throat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, we can’t keep explaining everything. Read that book we got you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She hit on me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait-wait-wait. Are you telling us that old lady wanted to have sex with you in exchange for giving your department millions of dollars?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You lucky duck.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re really a broken toy, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was able to get out of there before anything else happened, but she wants to see me again tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent! What are you planning to wear?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, you’re an expert on trading sexual favours for material gain, walk him through this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, n-no, hold on a second, I’m not going to sleep with her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But we need a cryogenic centrifugal pump.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, forget it! It’s not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, come now, Leonard, this may be your only chance to make a real contribution to science!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I repeat, not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What was all that about me trading sexual favours for material gain?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was a compliment. I believe in giving credit where credit is due.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on phone)
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I’ll tell him. Leonard, Mrs. Latham’s car is here for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I won’t be too late. I’m just gonna make a final pitch for the funding and then say good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on, I have something for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just a few things you may need tonight. There’s, uh, baby oil, condoms and, uh, a little something I procured from the school of pharmacology. They say it is to Viagra as Viagra is to a green M_M.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am not going to have sex with her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe this will overcome your reluctance. I went on the Internet and found a photograph of a 25-year-old Mrs. Latham to get your libido humming. Check out those saddle shoes. Rar!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you insane? I’m not going to prostitute myself just so we can get some new equipment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, come on! Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good night, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Given how much time you spend engaging in pointless self-abuse, you might consider, just this once, using your genitalia to actually accomplish something!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He still won’t shag the old lady, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. But thank you for asking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Hello, Leonard. I hope you’re hungry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m very hungry. For food, right?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Oh, I made you uncomfortable last night. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, that’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: No, it most certainly is not. Leonard, I’m making the donation to your department regardless of what happens between us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, of course. There’s no quid pro quo here. You and your colleagues are doing remarkable research, and you deserve the money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Then what was last night about?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: I took a shot, sue me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: You’re a very handsome man, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: It was foolish of me to think someone your age might ever be interested in someone like me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, don’t say that. You’re a very attractive woman.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Oh, please.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s true.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, aren’t you sweet. Just for the record, you’d remember a night with me for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sure I would. But why, why, exactly?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: You’re a very smart man. How do you think I landed such a rich husband?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hadn’t really given it much thought.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Well, think about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Latham
utterance.content: Yep. I’m that good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, what the hell.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good morning, slut.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, please, I recognize the walk of shame when I see it. All you’re missing is a little smeared mascara and a purse with panties wadded up in it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, nothing’s going on. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you just getting home?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a good sign, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m so proud of you! You sold yourself out like a common streetwalker!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I didn’t do it for the money.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She stiffed you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I believe that’s what your roommate did to her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Again, read the book we gave you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I mean, I, I, I got the money first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Smart. Get paid up front. Yeah, I think you have a real knack for gigolo work, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I’m gonna go lie down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a good idea, get your rest. There are a lot more rich old ladies out there, and Daddy needs a new linear accelerator. And I thought he didn’t learn anything from his relationship with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Another compliment! Learn to recognize them.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Ah, there he is! The man of the hour! He took one for the team!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t do it for the money!

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Keep telling yourself that, it makes it easier. Trust me, I know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Cool, buddy! That’s awesome!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How was she?
